akn:content.akn:p:
§ 2338. Exclusive Federal jurisdiction The district courts of the United States shall have exclusive jurisdiction over an action brought under this chapter. (Added Pub. L. 102–572, title X, § 1003(a)(4), Oct. 29, 1992, 106 Stat. 4524.)
Statutory Notes and Related Subsidiaries Effective DateSection applicable to any pending case or any cause of action arising on or after 4 years before Oct. 29, 1992, see section 1003(c) of Pub. L. 102–572, set out as a note under section 2331 of this title.
